channel.title: Pages on Pavel Iosad
channel.description: Recent content in Pages on Pavel Iosad

item.title: About my name
item.description: My name is obviously problematic for English speakers (or indeed for Russian speakers), so I’m just putting this up for future reference. In Russian, my surname is Иосад, pronounced in Modern Standard Russian as something like [i.aˈsat] — that’s two onsetless syllables in a row, plus final devoicing. English speakers rightly ignore the final devoicing, but the two first syllables can still be a problem. The suggested version for English speakers is [ˈjɔːsəd], with the vowel of thought.

item.title: Representation and variation in substance-free phonology: A case study in Celtic
item.description: Here you will find some material related to my PhD thesis entitled Representation and variation in substance-free phonology, which I submitted to the University of Tromsø on 3rd August 2012 and which I successfully defended in a viva voce examination on 18th February 2013. The official version of the thesis can be downloaded from Munin, the University of Tromsø’s institutional repository, here You can download the LaTeX source code for the thesis here There is an interview I did for the faculty’s web site (it is in Norwegian).
